p: Thiol-ene (TEC) and thiol-yne (TYC) couplings are the most commonly employed chemistries for the preparation of plant-oil-derived polyols (hydroxyl building blocks) ( Figure 19) [ 318, 319]. By applying thiol-yne coupling chemistry to alkyne-derivatized fatty acids from naturally occurring oleic and 10-undecenoic acids (mainly obtained from sunflower oil saponification and castor oil pyrolysis), bio-based methyl-ester-containing polyols for PU technology were obtained ( Figure 20).
